name: Impersonations and Impostors Online Quiz | People | 10 Questions

questions.text: 'Fate sent you here. Fate sends you now to Strelsau.' These lines are spoken to persuade a man to impersonate a king in what literary classic?
questions.explanation:
Prisoner of Zenda.

	Anthony Hope's classic novel tells of how news of a kidnapping of a king is concealed by the impersonation of a distant relative. (Stewart Granger in the 1952 movie version.)

questions.text: The importance of impersonation is a key plot device that is used by characters named Jack and Algernon in what classic play?
questions.explanation:
Importance of Being Earnest.

	Oscar Wilde's clever comedy, 'The Importance of Being Earnest'.

questions.text: A book and (1959 movie) were based on the real life impersonation of this WW II general.
questions.explanation:
Montgomery.

	'I Was Monty's Double'. Why not use a ringer to throw the other side off?

questions.text: Perhaps the most famous literary impersonation is found in 'Cyrano De Bergerac'. There, Cyrano writes love letters to Roxanne, but pretends that they come from someone else. Who is the would-be writer that Cyrano is impersonating?
questions.explanation:
Christian.

	It didn't work out well for any of them in Edmund Rostand's tale.

questions.text: Shakespeare used the device of multiple twins in this play to create light-hearted confusion of identity.
questions.explanation:
Comedy of Errors.

	Two sets of twins. It gets a bit complicated.

questions.text: The movie 'Dead Ringer' stars this prominent actress in a dual role as identical twins.
questions.explanation:
Bette Davis.

	One is good; one isn't.

questions.text: 'The Great Impostor' was the movie version of a true story about a man who engaged in several impersonations. Who played the title role?
In 'A Tale of Two Cities', the plot revolves (to some extent) around the physical similarity of two men. Which statement is correct?
questions.correct: Sydney Carton impersonates Charles Darnay and is executed
options: Charles Darnay impersonates Sydney Carton and is executed
Sydney Carton impersonates Dr. Manette and is executed
Charles Darnay impersonates Dr. Manette and is executed
questions.explanation:
Sydney Carton impersonates Charles Darnay and is executed.

	'It is a far, far better thing I do ...'

questions.text: It has been suggested that many people other than Shakespeare actually wrote Shakespeare's plays. One of the leading contenders for the title of 'actual author' is Christopher Marlowe. Which of the following is NOT true of Marlowe?
options: It has been suggested that his death was a ruse to conceal his disappearance
He was probably involved in espionage activities
questions.explanation:
All are true.

	Marlowe was killed in an altercation at a private home (not at a bar). All of the people present were involved, directly or indirectly, with espionage activities. Some say Marlowe was {assassinated;} others say he faked his death in order to conveniently disappear. Marlowe was out on bail at the time on charges of atheism. (Fellow playwright Thomas Kyd was no so lucky.)

questions.text: It has been suggested that Lee Harvey Oswald was impersonated during his supposed visit to this city shortly before the assassination of JFK.
questions.explanation:
Mexico City.

	A man claiming to be Oswald was in Mexico City shortly before the JFK killing. There is, however, evidence that it wasn't really Oswald.
